snippet: A Chicago businessman was sentenced to 14 years in prison on Thursday for providing material support to overseas terrorist groups, including a Pakistani group that killed more than 160 people in Mumbai, India, in 2008.
abstract: Chicago businessman Tahawwur Rana is sentenced to 14 years in prison for providing material support to overseas terrorist groups, including Lashkar-e-Taiba, Pakistani group that killed more than 160 people in Mumbai, India, in 2008.
lead_paragraph: A Chicago businessman was sentenced to 14 years in prison on Thursday for providing material support to overseas terrorist groups, including a Pakistani group that killed more than 160 people in Mumbai, India, in 2008.

headline.main: Chicago Man Sent to Prison for 14 Years for Aiding Pakistani Terrorist Group
headline.print_headline: Chicago Man Sent to Prison for 14 Years For Aiding Pakistani Terrorist Group
